results.title: You're not communicating
results.creator_credit: Jerry A Callner, Callner Film Productions and Veriation Films
results.brief_description: Communication is a two-way process that depends equally on the efforts of the message sender and the message receiver. But too often, interpersonal communication breaks down. Knowing how to communicate effectively is a vital skill. And understanding the communication process and why it breaks down is the key to improved skills.
results.creator_credit_for_label: Jerry A Callner, Callner Film Productions and Veriation Films

results.title: You're no good
results.creator_credit: George Kaczender, John Kemeny and ONF | NFB
results.brief_description: A story of the impulses of youth that often clash with society’s need for circumspection, law and order. Eddie makes the mistake of “borrowing” a motor cycle parked in front of a bike shop. He takes his girlfriend for a joy ride before the law intervenes. A commentary on a society that often offers youth little purpose or sense of accomplishment.

results.title: You're Fired
results.creator_credit: John Taylor, Film Victoria and Taylormade Films
results.brief_description: An animated film which deals with fire prevention around the home, the need to plan escape routes and what to do if fire occurs. Using a lively quiz show format featuring devilish Hot Harry, the film teaches children about fire hazards.

results.title: You're eating for two
results.creator_credit: Malca Gillson, Tom Daly and ONF | NFB
results.brief_description: This film is designed to teach pregnant women how to give birth to a healthy, happy baby. It explains what is meant by a balanced diet. It also touches upon other aspects, such as prenatal exercises and proper weight gain. The message of the film is clear: good nutrition may be as important for proper mental and physical development before birth as afterwards.

results.title: You'll soon get the hang of it
results.brief_description: Aims to impart the basic psychology of training and motivation and how to apply it when passing on knowledge and skills to a trainee. John Cleese uses a variety of situations - manual, clerical and technical - to put over the essential points and illustrate the major pitfalls.

results.title: You'll get yours when you're 65
results.brief_description: A look at Social Security, how it works and its effect on the nation’s aged. Questions raised include how social or how secure one can be on today’s pensions and some administration plans for the future are discussed.

results.title: Yorkshire sands
results.creator_credit: Tony Thompson and British Transport Films
results.brief_description: Light verse and gay music make their own comment on the holiday makers of the Yorkshire coastline. Between Tees and Humber thousands each year enjoy the sea and the ands, the funfair, and the ballroom; for a row or a romance, there’s something for each.

results.title: York Cathedral
results.brief_description: A study of York Minister, famous for its XIV century west front, its solemn and impressive nave, lofty choir, and beautiful reredos. Includes views of transepts, Lady Chapel, High Alter, ancient stained glass windows, sculptures, and the relics of the crypt.

results.title: Yokihi = Princess Yang Kwei Fei
results.creator_credit: Kenji Mizoguchi, Masaichi Nagata, Run Run Shaw, Daiei Motion Picture Company and Shaw Brothers
results.brief_description:
The Chinese Emperor Genso of the Tang Dynast marries a beautiful scullery maid on the death of his wife, with whom he falls in love. The new empress is destroyed by jealousies and intrigue around her as a popular revolt rises against the couple. This film uses an exquisite colour range with costumes and decor to relay the characters’ emotional turmoil. A film about political intrigue and corruption in 8th century China, ‘Princess Yang Kwei Fei’ depicts the dying stages of a dynasty. In the film’s final scenes the Emperor, who has survived the uprising but is old and unhappy, is mystically reunited with his deceased wife.

Credits: Producer, Masaichi Nagata, Run Run Shaw ; director, Kenji Mizoguchi ; writer, Yoda Yoshikata, Matsutaro Kawaguchi, Masashige Narusawa, Tao Jin ; photography, Kohei Sugiyama ; music, Hayasaka Fumio.
Cast: Machiko Kyo, Masayuki Mori, So Yamamura, Eitaro Ozawa, Eitaro Shindo, Haruko Sugimura.

results.title: Yoke Heng's story
results.creator_credit: Brian Salt and Malayan Film Unit
results.brief_description: Deals with Singapore’s social welfare services. Tells the story of Yoke Heng, a sixteen-year-old boy from crowded Chinatown show cares for his five brothers and sisters while both his parents are in hospital. The hospital almoner is able to help the family secure one of the modern flats being erected on the outskirts of the city. On the parents’ recovery, the family is reunited in their new home.
